intro: Lexipyretum luteum, commonly known as the yellow fever plant, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species with medicinal properties. The plant is characterized by its yellow-orange flowers and hairy, opposite leaves. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its potential medicinal uses, it has been studied for its bioactive compounds.
